title-part.text: MACHINES FOR MAKING RAILWAYS OF ALL KINDS

reference.text: derailing or rerailing blocks on track, track brakes or retarders B61K

note.note-paragraph: In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

Other means for supporting the sleepers or the track

reference.text: draining by trenches, culverts, or conduits E01F5/00

with prefabricated elements embedded in fresh concrete or asphalt
with sleeper shoes
with interlocking means to withstand horizontal forces
Drainage of track

the clip being a shaped plate

Fastening the rail in the chair
Rail fastenings making use of clamps or braces supporting the side of the rail
Rail fastenings gripping or encircling the sleeper
Rail fastenings allowing the adjustment of the position of the rails, so far as not included in the preceding groups
Pads or the like, e.g. of wood, rubber, placed under the rail, tie-plate, or chair

note.note-paragraph: If the subject to be classified has more than one characteristic, classification is made in group E01B9/68 and indexing codes for the different characteristics are given

layered or composite

title-part.text: Placing, renewing, working, cleaning, or taking-up the ballast, with or without concurrent work on the track

by devices moving on the track with or without spreading or levelling

by means of non-driven tools
by means of driven tools, e.g. rotating brooms or digging devices

along between the tracks only

for horizontally-arranged fastening elements, e.g. fish-bolts

title-part.text: Working rail or other metal track components on the spot
Sectioning or slitting, e.g. by sawing, shearing, flame-cutting
Making holes, e.g. by drilling, punching, flame-cutting
Bending, e.g. for straightening rails or rail joints

reference.text: for aligning rail ends to be welded E01B29/46

title-part.text: Reconditioning or repairing worn or damaged parts on the spot, e.g. applying inlays, building-up rails by welding

Working or treating non-metal sleepers in or on the line, e.g. marking, creosoting
Cutting or grinding wooden sleepers, e.g. for forming rail seats

using other means than driven wheels as propulsion means
